page.title: 11MY TYPICAL DAY IN DERVOCK.
page.content: My name is David McLernon, I am 11. On school days I get up at {7.30,}have breakfast of porridge and toast with butter and jam and tea. I wash, brush my teeth and dress. Usually I bring crisps for morning break and walk to school with my younger brother Frank, which takes about{5 minutes.}School starts at{9am}and finihes at{3pm.}At break and lunchtime I enjoy playing football with my friends. After school I do my homework first, which usually takes about half an hour, then I might go to the shop in the village for mother. I like to play in the hut I made with my friends, or have a game of rounders, hide-and-seek or football, and usually watch some programmes on children's television. I am a member of the{Junior Orange Lodge which meets once a month. If I can't play outside, I stay inside and draw.
